SEARCH
Package org.example.gui.component.account

Class TwoFactorAuthentication

java.lang.Object
org.example.gui.component.account.TwoFactorAuthentication
public class TwoFactorAuthentication extends Object
A utility class for handling Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) functionality. It provides methods to generate a verification code, send it via email, and verify user input.

  • Constructor Details

    • TwoFactorAuthentication

      public TwoFactorAuthentication()

  • Method Details

    • generateAndSendCode

      public static String generateAndSendCode(String email, String username)
      Generates a random 6-character verification code and sends it to the specified email address.
      Parameters:
      email - The recipient's email address to send the verification code.
      username - The username of the recipient, used in the email subject.
      Returns:
      The generated verification code.

    • generateRandomCode

      private static String generateRandomCode()
      Generates a random 6-character code using a predefined set of characters. The code is composed of uppercase letters, lowercase letters, and digits, excluding easily confused characters.
      Returns:
      A randomly generated 6-character code.

    • verifyCode

      public static boolean verifyCode(String generatedCode, String code)
      Verifies if the entered code matches the generated verification code.
      Parameters:
      generatedCode - The verification code generated and sent to the user.
      code - The code entered by the user.
      Returns:
      true if the entered code matches the generated code, otherwise false.

    • verifyCodeAndClose

      public static boolean verifyCodeAndClose(JTextField[] codeFields, String generatedCode)
      Verifies if the code entered across multiple fields matches the generated verification code. The fields are concatenated and compared to the generated code.
      Parameters:
      codeFields - An array of text fields containing the user's input.
      generatedCode - The verification code that was sent to the user.
      Returns:
      true if the concatenated input from the fields matches the generated code, otherwise false.

    • areFieldsFull

      public static boolean areFieldsFull(JTextField[] codeFields)
      Checks if all the fields in the given array are filled with user input.
      Parameters:
      codeFields - An array of text fields representing the user input for the verification code.
      Returns:
      true if all fields are filled, otherwise false.
